movie_title: 10.1 Facts - Cows Vs Sharks & Ancient Rap Battles
introduction: Hello and welcome to a brand new feature on 101 Facts - 10.1! A tenth of what you're used to with 10

vocabulary.definition: the branch of medicine that deals with the incidence, distribution, and possible control of diseases and other factors relating to health
vocabulary.example: John Snow's work in epidemiology helped identify the source of the cholera outbreak.

vocabulary.definition: a battle of insults and wits, often done poetically, dating back to the 5th century
vocabulary.example: In ancient England and Scotland, flighting was a popular form of entertainment among nobles.

vocabulary.definition: to take someone else's work or ideas and pass them off as one's own
vocabulary.example: The student was expelled for attempting to plagiarize a famous author's poem.

vocabulary.definition: an argument or dispute, typically one marked by anger or hostility
vocabulary.example: The siblings often had a quarrel over who got to use the computer first.

vocabulary.definition: using irony, sarcasm, or ridicule to criticize or mock something
vocabulary.example: The show is known for its satirical take on political issues, often making viewers reflect on societal norms.

vocabulary.definition: ready to accept control or instruction; submissive
vocabulary.example: Despite their size, elephants are known to be docile creatures when treated with respect.
